data.title: Fixed ordered comparsion between pointer and zero in AssetImporter.cpp
data.body:
Tried to build Urho3D using clang, got error on that line. Seems like error: `mNumRotationKeys` and `mNumPositionKeys` are `unsigned int`'s while `mScalingKeys` is `C_STRUCT aiVectorKey*`, so comparing this pointer to the inequality with NULL seems more logical.

Hope I did not break anything with that change.

data.title: Error with Maximizing Window
data.body: I'd have to go back and build with 1.6, but I think in switching from 1.6 to HEAD calling Graphics::Maximize() increases the size of the window, but leaves the game rendering to the same size region (placed in the lower left of the window) though the view is changed to match the new full window size (i.e. that little region is 'zoomed in' on the lower left part of the camera, with everything else black). It only occurs when running through the discrete graphics card (using optirun), so this may just be a problem with bumblebee, and not with Urho. Maximizing the window with the window controls exhibits the same behavior, but if I resize the window by grabbing the borders it works properly (it also works properly with the Ctrl+Alt+NumPad5 shortcut that resizes the window to fill the screen without maximizing it, and then maximizes it if pressed again).

data.title: "Smart" techniques
data.body:
The thing that our designers found complicated in Urho3D is the assignment of material techniques. They are used to working with 3ds Max, which has a small number of material types with a rich set of parameters. Why would not Urho3D work in the same way? The engine could have special "smart" techniques which set the shader defines and the render states based on material parameters. _Default.xml_ technique, for example, can replace all techniques with the standard lighting model. As result,
```
<material>
    <technique name="Techniques/Default.xml" />
    <texture unit="diffuse" name="Textures/diffuse.png" />
    <texture unit="specular" name="Textures/specular.png" />
    <parameter name="MatDiffColor" value="1 1 1 0.5" />
</material>
```
will be equal to a material with the _DiffSpecAlpha.xml_ technique.
Other possible "smart" techniques are _PBR.xml_, _Unlit.xml_, _Particle.xml_.

I suggest to @cadaver to consider the feasibility of this feature, and want to know how useful it will be for the engine's users.

data.title: is geometry vertex count not equals to vertex buffer vertex count?
GetExistingResource AngelScript Binding Error
WeakPtr and friend class
Prevent sending events for subscribers added during event handling.
data.body: ... and other minor changes.

data.title: CrowdManager get hang when received E_NAVIGATION_MESH_REBUILT event
data.body:
When I build `DynamicNavigationMesh`, it sends `E_NAVIGATION_MESH_REBUILT` event and make `CrowdManager` hang because it re-subscribe to `E_NAVIGATION_MESH_REBUILT` inside event handler (see `SetNavigationMesh`) and then endlessly re-receive the same event.

Note: My `DynamicNavigationMesh` is _not_ stored in `Scene`, but the `CrowdManager` is.

I've patched event handler in `CrowdManager` but I am unsure that it is good fix.
Shall we probably do something at the level of event system?

Do we really want newly added listeners to receive "current" event?

data.body: Hello! I found that E_BACKGROUNDLOADED listeners are not able to use just loaded resources becouse of resources are not exist in the cache when event is raised. So, where is a fix, as i tough. Hope, it will be merged. Thanx.

data.title: Possible editor bug: can't run editor from SDK installation if resource path doesn't equal to SDK's Data.
data.body:
I build latest Urho3D (from master branch) and then I generate Urho3D SDK using `make install`.
Editor from Urho3D works perfectly if resource path is setted to SDK's Data. In my system it's `D:/CXXProjects/Urho3D-Windows-Static-Build/SDK/share/Resources/Data/`.
Then I set resource path to my project data (`D:/CXXProjects/colonization/colonization/bin/Data/`).
Then I restart editor and editor console shows this error:
```
[Wed Jul 05 21:06:42 2017] ERROR: Scripts/Editor/EditorTerrain.as:33,9 - Exception 'Null pointer access' in 'void TerrainEditorBrushVisualizer::Hide()'
AngelScript callstack:
	Scripts/Editor/EditorTerrain.as:void TerrainEditorBrushVisualizer::Hide():33,9
	Scripts/Editor/EditorTerrain.as:void TerrainEditor::HideBrushVisualizer():142,9
	Scripts/Editor/EditorView.as:void ViewMouseMove():1833,13
	Scripts/Editor/EditorEventsHandlers.as:void EditorMainHandleMouseMove(StringHash, VariantMap&inout):58,5
```
I can't use editor because it spams this error to console and doesn't shows any inspector windows.

data.title: Fix Graphics::GetHighDPI() on OS X (closes #2009)
Graphics::GetHighDPI() always returns true on OS X
data.body:
The docs for GetHighDPI() say "Return whether window is high DPI", but in fact it just returns the value of the EP_HIGH_DPI engine parameter, which defaults to true.

GetHighDPI() should check whether the window is really high DPI.

data.title: Scale kerning values correctly (closes #2007)
Kerning values are not scaled correctly
data.body:
When reading TrueType kerning tables, we don't currently scale the kerning values to match the size of the font. This means the kerning is too tight at small font sizes, as seen in this screenshot (the smallest size actually ends up with negative width):

![kerning_bug](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/252111/27875293-4c478c54-6178-11e7-9d5f-bc894c2be848.png)

data.title: PhysicsWorld2D in child node
data.body: There seem to be no established ways to manage different "scenes" like other game frameworks. I am trying to move all child nodes and related components under a parent node. `PhysicsWorld2D` does not fully work if I add it to a child node of a `Scene`. `PhysicsWorld2D::GetRigidBody` does not return a body to the same screen coordinates I clicked anymore. `PhysicsWorld2D::DrawDebugGeometry` does not draw anything. Is it true that `PhysicsWorld2D` must be added to a `Scene`?

data.title: Add CSV and Base64 encodings for TmxFile (#1325)
data.body: TmxFile currently supports only deprecated XML layer format. This PR adds support for CSV and Base64 formats. I'm not sure it fixes #1325, since compression is still not supported (zlib nor gzip). Base64 decompression snippet taken from https://stackoverflow.com/a/13935718 with some minor modifications to work with Urho's containers instead of std

data.title: Fix kerning pairs (#2003)
data.body:
Kerning values were being associated with the wrong char codes.
This was broken in commit 39930c9a, which moved some code around
to ensure that the space character is always the first one loaded.

data.title: Font kerning is broken
data.body:
Kerning values are associated with the wrong char codes. This is due to an off-by-one error introduced by my own commit 39930c9ab492 -- doh! Sorry about that, will fix ASAP.

Additionally, I'm not sure that the kerning values are being interpreted correctly. I don't see any scaling from abstract em units to on-screen pixels. But I could be wrong, I'll investigate further.

data.title: Minor incoherence fix
data.body: Different platform-specific functions return different values upon failure, for example one returns `String::EMPTY` while another returns `(?)`. From now on everything will return `(?)` if the function doesn't succeed.

data.title: Working directory is not respected when prefixing resource paths.
data.body:
Changing the working directory does not affect the `FileSystem::GetProgramDir` result (_on windows at least_) and as such, when `resourcePrefixPaths` are being processed inside `Engine::InitializeResourceCache`, the paths are prefixed with the path of the executable and not the working directory.

Not sure if this is the intended behavior but I find it more preferable to use the working directory than the actual executable path.

For example. I may group my binaries in sub-folders like `win##`, `linux##` and I would like to not have to duplicate the resources in each of those folders. Of course, I could manually add such a prefix path, but having it by default seems more appropriate.

I could've sworn this is how it worked so far because this only occurred when I pulled the latest source from the repository.

data.title: Add configurable oversampling to improve subpixel font rendering (#1953)
data.body:
Subpixel-positioned text looks blurry, due to bilinear filtering of the
underlying texture. The basic idea here is to stretch the font glyphs
horizontally to increase the sharpness at subpixel positions. Note that
the stretched images need to be smoothed to avoid aliasing artifacts;
this is done in the FontFaceFreeType::BoxFilter() method.

Glyphs are always pixel-aligned vertically, so no vertical oversampling
is needed.

To make this feature comprehensible (I hope!) I've removed the
'subpixelGlyphPositions' flag and replaced it with a couple of values:
'fontSubpixelThreshold' sets the point at which subpixel positioning
kicks on, and 'fontOversampleLimit' caps the maximum amount of stretching.

The default values are 12pt text and max 3x oversampling. These are fairly
conservative settings, which should improve small text without wasting
a lot of memory.

Note that when the font hint level is NORMAL (the default), subpixel
positioning and oversampling are both disabled. So, this feature doesn't
change any default behavior, and applies some hopefully sensible values
if the hint level is set to LIGHT or NONE.

data.title: Invoking CollisionChain2D::RecreateFixture() multiple times causes memory leak
data.body:
Using Valgrind I noticed memory leak when invoking `CollisionChain2D::SetVertex` to change last vertex. This causes `RecreateFixture()` to be called. `RecreateFixture()`, in turn, does the following:

    if (loop_)
        chainShape_.CreateLoop(&b2Vertices[0], count);
    else
        chainShape_.CreateChain(&b2Vertices[0], count);
But both of these Box2D methods  contains the following string:

    b2Assert(m_vertices == nullptr && m_count == 0); //From github, Urho3D version uses NULL instead

Thus, this contract is broken when one CollisionChain2D component is modified multiple times (I had tried to create simple deformable terrain using this component). It causes the old 'm_vertices' array to be lost every time. Such a code should also crash if asserts are enabled.

Adding 'chainShape_.Clear()' before above code in 'CollisionChain2D' will probably fix this problem. Attaching pull request.

P.S. Don't have much experience with either C++ and github contributing, so I'm not sure if I'm doing right opening issue and creating pull request simultaneously (and that this solution is correct). And sorry for non-native english.

P.P.S. I also noticed that a new 'b2ChainShape' instance is created when calling 'CollisionShape2D::CreateFixture()' and is destroyed when calling 'CollisionShape2D::ReleaseFixture()'. This is unlikely to be mistake, stating it just in case.

data.title: Samples are missing .html files to launch for Emscripten
data.body:
Running with

```bash
git clone https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3d.git
cd Urho3d
mkdir build_emcc
./cmake_emscripten.sh build_emcc
cd build_emcc
make
```

ends up generating a `build_emcc/bin/` directory with content from all the samples, but each sample only contains a `.data` and a `.js` file and no `.html` file to launch. I wonder if the method to run has changed somehow, or if this is a regression?

data.title: -s DISABLE_EXCEPTION_CATCHING=1 in Emscripten
data.body:
Reading [Emscripten-specific CMake flags](https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/blob/master/CMake/Modules/UrhoCommon.cmake#L680), there's

```CMake
# Preserve LLVM debug information, show line number debug comments, and generate source maps; always disable exception handling codegen
set (CMAKE_EXE_LINKER_FLAGS_DEBUG "${CMAKE_EXE_LINKER_FLAGS_DEBUG} -g4 -s DISABLE_EXCEPTION_CATCHING=1")
set (CMAKE_MODULE_LINKER_FLAGS_DEBUG "${CMAKE_MODULE_LINKER_FLAGS_DEBUG} -g4 -s DISABLE_EXCEPTION_CATCHING=1")
```

the comment says it's desired to always disable exception handling codegen, but in the following code, `-s DISABLE_EXCEPTION_CATCHING=1` is only added for linker flags in debug build. Perhaps that was intended to be as follows?

```CMake
set (CMAKE_EXE_LINKER_FLAGS_DEBUG "${CMAKE_EXE_LINKER_FLAGS_DEBUG} -g4")
set (CMAKE_MODULE_LINKER_FLAGS_DEBUG "${CMAKE_MODULE_LINKER_FLAGS_DEBUG} -g4")
set (CMAKE_EXE_LINKER_FLAGS "${CMAKE_EXE_LINKER_FLAGS} -s DISABLE_EXCEPTION_CATCHING=1")
set (CMAKE_MODULE_LINKER_FLAGS "${CMAKE_MODULE_LINKER_FLAGS} -s DISABLE_EXCEPTION_CATCHING=1")
```

(or is the comment outdated?)

Additionally, it is worth noting that `-s DISABLE_EXCEPTION_CATCHING=1` only suppresses catching by making `try-catch` statements no-op fall throughs, but C++ code is still allowed to `throw`, in which case those throws will propagate up to JavaScript code to handle, e.g. `window.onerror()` as last resort.

Searching for `-fno-exceptions` in Urho3D, I find the following:

```
e:\code\urho3d\CMake\Toolchains\Android.cmake:
  101  #
  102  #     Possible values are:
  103: #       system         -> Use the minimal system C++ runtime library. Implies -fno-rtti -fno-exceptions.
  104  #       gabi++_static  -> Use the GAbi++ runtime as a static library.
  105  #       gabi++_shared  -> Use the GAbi++ runtime as a shared library.
  ...
  572              set (CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS "${CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS} -fexceptions" CACHE INTERNAL "CXX Compiler flags")
  573          else ()
  574:             set (CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS "${CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS} -fno-exceptions" CACHE INTERNAL "CXX Compiler flags")
  575          endif ()
  576          set (CMAKE_EXE_LINKER_FLAGS -Wl,-z,nocopyreloc)

e:\code\urho3d\Source\Clang-Tools\CMakeLists.txt:
   64      set (CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS "${CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS} /EHs-c- /GR-")
   65  else ()
   66:     set (CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS "${CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS} -fno-exceptions -fno-rtti")
   67  endif ()
   68  

e:\code\urho3d\Source\ThirdParty\LuaJIT\src\lj_err.c:
   56  ** TARGET_CFLAGS), all of your C/Lua binding code, all loadable C modules
   57  ** and all C libraries that have callbacks which may be used to call back
   58: ** into Lua. C++ code must *not* be compiled with -fno-exceptions.
   59  **
   60  ** EXT cannot be enabled on WIN32 since system exceptions use code-driven SEH.
```

Is Urho3D generally compiled with `-fno-exceptions` and/or `-fno-rtti`? In Emscripten `-s DISABLE_EXCEPTION_CATCHING=1` is often paired with `-fno-exceptions` to disallow `throw` statements as well - would that be intentional for Urho3D?

data.title: fixed loading user defined tile properties from tileset-file.
data.body:
i've added a user-defined property to a tile in tileset-file (of course via tiled editor). this property was placed within a \<objectgroup\> tag not directly beneath \<tile\> tag as existing code assumed it.

here is the tileset file produced from tiled. i've added the property named "blocked" at tile with id=1.

```
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<tileset name="Tiles" tilewidth="8" tileheight="8" tilecount="6" columns="3">
 <image source="Tiles.png" width="24" height="16"/>
 <tile id="0">
  <objectgroup draworder="index"/>
 </tile>
 <tile id="1">
  <objectgroup draworder="index">
   <properties>
    <property name="blocked" type="bool" value="true"/>
   </properties>
  </objectgroup>
 </tile>
</tileset>
```

data.title: Add a 'subpixel glyph positions' option to UI (#1953)
data.body:
When this option is enabled, text will be formatted with subpixel
(fractional) positions on the x-axis. Positions on the y-axis are
still pixel-aligned.

Note that this option has no effect if the hinting level is set
to FONT_HINT_LEVEL_NORMAL, as each glyph is rounded to an integral
pixel size by the hinter. It only makes a different if the hinting
mode is LIGHT (vertical hinting only) or NONE.

With subpixel positioning, the output will look blurrier due to
texture filtering. TODO: Add horizontal oversampling to improve
sharpness. That needs extra memory so it should be configurable.
